DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date the tissue sample was placed in RNAlater.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a submitted tissue sample, removed using a needle with a relatively large diameter,  being preserved using for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA. :Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
